content: with the dead, you can only speak “of” not “to” or “with”: la mort dans l’âme
de Man led one to think the very possibility of reading
memories so overwhelming, we prefer to be alone w/ them
Derrida overwhelmed by memories of de Man, everything is painful, so painful
[death, real death: the worst?]
tu meurs (you are dying, tumor) [see pp. 87-8n tumeur, a memory untranslatable from French)
Übersetzung (set against, translate)
Mémoires: changes from singular to plural, ungenders

Derrida, lover of memory, never knew how to tell a story, never received gift (doron) of Mnemosyne, the wax imprint, an eidolon [Derrida has a relation to memory beyond the imprint?]: keeps the memory loses the narrative
two impossible mournings: 1) incorporate other as idol 2) refuse to incorporate: infinite remove
Derrida adds: impossible to reduce a thinking of the law to a thinking of Being
Heidegger links law & Being in Hölderlin, de Man contests
name must appeal to law in some way

if memory maneuvers btwn law and Being, can one think the being and law of memory? these questions move through transference & translation, above abyss; require impossible passageways: “the fragile resistance of a span” [hymen?]
for de Man, allegory possibility to say the other, precludes totalization—the exhaustive narrative or total absorption of a memory
auto-interpretive figure of deconstruction makes it hard to subsume under meta-discourse, general narrative

deconstruction grows strong by accumulating forces that try to repress it, w/out being able to totalize them, “like those surplus values from which a victim of aggression always profits” > here, totalization is what an account, story and narrative are denied

de Man: Nietzsche anticipated difference btwn constative/performative in deconstructive gesture, thought of undecidable: deconstruction of illusion that episteme (truth) could be replaced w/doxa (persuasion) [anti-relativism]
deconstruction: plus d’une langue
deconstruction: plus d’une langue

[re: de Man closer to Heidegger than he thinks] for Heidegger, memory too, like promise, gathers near what can come, toward the “future” > es gibt never gives anything in present, it calls as a promise; Heissen (“to call, ” “to command” > entrust, keep safely)
not only one deconstruction
Derrida on how professional philosophers (Searle, Danto) concerned w/ progress of deconstruction indict philosophical naïveté of poor literary scholar
one cannot and should not totalize meaning of ongoing structure [re: deconstruction] when its structure is one of transference
“America is deconstruction” > no, we learn from deconstruction to suspend hasty attributions of proper names
affirmation (yes, yes) that seals alliance, via de Man > alliance not secret because occult but because it commits before and beyond anything else
de Man’s affirmation of memory, an alliance or ring more ancient, secret, resistant than familial or strategic alliances it makes possible, but is never reduced to
Baudelaire links mourning and obsession
”yes” commits w/ no content must repeat itself: yes yes, must bind itself to memory for memory, if anything’s to come from future [alliance btwn memory and seal of yes, yes]
we remain in disbelief itself, we will never believe in death or immortality

the being “in us” of other in bereaved memory, not resurrection of other himself, can’t be included in narcissistic fantasy of subjectivity closed in on itself > other so marks narcissistic structure that being “in us” becomes coming of the other
when we know our friend to be gone forever: terrifying lucidity, in light of incinerating blaze where nothingness appears
the dead: receive nothing of what takes place in memory
de Man’s “Autobiography as Defacement”
the other is dead and nothing can save him from this death
we cannot save the dead from death or include dead in narcissistic fantasy; the bereaved memory: first coming of the Other
de Man: autobiography is “a figure of reading…that occurs in all texts”
in terms of speech acts, law takes form of the performative
performative function in de Man: once gathering of Being & totalizing of memory are impossible > fatality of tropological substitution (non-totalization)
fatality (of tropological dislocation) is the law, non-totalization [impossibility of coming into being], the law of the law, that the law takes turns w/, as if it were, its own supplement
de Man: we always re-enter a system of tropes
tropology of memory in autobiographical discourse > discourse as epitaph, signature of its own epitaph (prosopopoeia)
the sovereign, secret, ideal signature—the most giving: the one that knows how to efface itself

de Man’s epitaph, the prosopopoeia he addresses to us from an incineration all the more sublime for having no tomb [cremated?]—emblazoned spirit: figure of effacement, the effacement of visible figure in prosopopoeia
de Man: prosopon poiein, to confer a mask or face, “prosopopoeia is the trope of autobiography…by which one’s name…is made memorable as a face” > (dis)figuration
finitude of memory, formed by trace of other in us > approach or remembrance of future (memory of mourning, mourning of memory)
no true mourning
no friendship w/out finitude
self only appears in bereaved allegory (even before actual death of other) [see p. 33]
no friendship w/out finitude
summary of work of mourning:
this finitude (finitude of friendship) does not take the form of a limit, but takes the form of the trace of the other in us, the other’s irreducible presence
all relation to others carries signature of memoirs-from-beyond-the-grave
de Manian criticism/deconstruction always analysis of “resistances” and symptoms they produce [i.e. “resistance to theory” in literary studies]
the coming of the impossible other, we love as such, affirming this to be good
if death teaches us anything it leaves no chance for any innocent desire for truth
experience at heart of memory (Being & law), memorial, memoirs, mournful in essence, contracts itself together in impossible affirmation of mourning [affirmation is possible]
any trace always trace of the other
can we mourn?: 1) are we capable of it? 2) do we have the right?
Freud & de Man on narcissism [scholarly banality: they both say Narcissus is an allegory]
narcissism (as speculation) too paradoxical, too cunning, to provide final word > instead, speculation whose ruses, mimes, strategies relinquish autonomy
impossible affirmation of mourning must be possible—impossible here is the Other, as he comes to us: as a mortal, to us mortals
w/out ever crossing the mirror of a certain speculation > [keep friend “in us”?]
light of self appears in relation to death of the other
possibility of death of the other in-forms any relation to other & finitude of memory

inconsolable [infinitely responsible] before finitude of memory: [want memory to be infinite?] possibility of impossible commands whole rhetoric of mourning, describes essence of memory > w/ dark light of this nothing (death of other) we learn other resists closure of our interiorizing memory [Freud’s “normal” “work of mourning” (ideally, quasi-literally devouring body/voice of other)]
Freud’s “normal” “work of mourning”: interiorizing idealization—devouring the other—mimetic interiorization is not fictive, it’s the origin of fiction, of apocryphal figuration

inconsolable [infinitely responsible] before finitude of memory: [want memory to be infinite?] possibility of impossible commands whole rhetoric of mourning, describes essence of memory > w/ dark light of this nothing (death of other) we learn other resists closure of our interiorizing memory [Freud’s “normal” “work of mourning” (ideally, quasi-literally devouring body/voice of other)]
we come to ourselves through memory of possible mourning, knowledge older than ourselves, de Man might say: unreadability of mourning

mimetic interiorization not just fictive, is origin of fiction, takes place in a body, makes place for body, soul, “ours” > death constitutes and makes manifest limits of me, us, obliged to harbor something greater than us w/in us
Erinnerung (memory & interiorization)
Erinnerung: memory & interiorization
failure to interiorize the other succeeds in respecting the other as other

il faut: one must follow the trace, remember that which did not exist, the law [Being and law], only there in the aporia of mourning and prosopopoeia: 1) success fails: other becomes part of us, bear him in us, like a future 2) failure succeeds: aborted interorization, respect for other as other, other remains alone, outside us, in his death > schema makes true mourning impossible
Hegel: allegory of absolute memory
no choice but to let other speak, cannot make other speak w/out other having already spoken > in trace, part greater/less than whole
parts of memory [traces] that seem greater & older than us, pregnant w/ other: manifests in open but nocturnal space of agora, plus de lumière [Nietzsche’s not bright but open horizon]
uncontrollable necessity, nonsubjectivizable law of thought beyond interiorization, beyond un-mourning thought mourning > can we accept it? affirm it? can no longer become a question
allegorical metonymy—where part stands for whole and for more than whole it exceeds
other as other: “non-totalizable trace inadequate to itself and the same”
[Derrida identifies various contexts, figures, in which to describe the limits imposed on figures: Errinerung, then Psyche, now Mnemosyne—one day Paul de Man]
Gedächtnis calls itself beyond interiorizing memory (Erinnerung), beyond inclusion of part in whole, thinks itself as a “part” which is greater than “whole” > trace beyond mournful memory
Mnemosyne, mother of all muses, living source of inspiration—technique always feeds off Mnemosyne

all figures receive possibility from these paradoxical structures: 1) inclusion in set of a part greater than set 2) that which regulates our relation w/ other as other [not mourning in current sense], that the other is capable of dying (which is our “own” mortality too) conditions rhetoric of faithful memory, serves to seal an alliance & call us to an affirmation of the other
we think this (immeasurable grief & life of faithful friendship): sublimity of mourning w/out sublimation, w/out Freud’s triumph, w/out ‘paranoid fear’
de Man treats all historicism, periodization, narrative of origin as fables, fictions
“one day accounting will have to take place” of the damage of superficial reading
promise: not expectation or anticipation but commitment

apostrophe to naked name, magical incantation, “Lazarus, arise!” > “tropological spectrum” forbids this magic, and yet power/structure of name makes possible such magic, not only the desire but experience of hallucination
the dead can no longer answer the call of the name, only in memory
the essence of the proper name prevents “true mourning”
memory name of something preserves an essential & necessary relation w/ possibility of name
defect, default of name is its immense power: name already survives him, does not wait for death
“in memory of” both proper name and common noun (nom et nom), death reveals a proper name could always lend itself to repetition (in absence of bearer) becoming a common noun
“I” effaces its singularity as it designates it
fidelity requires that one quote, let other speak, and that one not restrict oneself to quoting > double law of Mnemosyne or common law of double source Mnemosyne/Lethe
“original materialism” in de Man > matter w/out presence, w/out substance
any nominal function is “in memory of”
de Man, via Hegel: memory effaces remembrances, like “I” effaces itself [I forgets I at beginning of sentence], “I cannot say I”
Paul de Man translates Hegel’s “Ich kann nicht sagen was ich (nur) meine” as ‘I cannot say I’ > effacing of I, a priori functional forgetting > “Autobiography as De-facement”
inscription of memory effaces interiorizing recollection, not because of external limit or finite limitation of memory, but because of [allegorical] structure of relation to Other (see p. 29)
finitude of memory ≠ finite limitation or external limit
de Man talks failure & negative, Derrida says failure of memory is not failure and negativity a power > creates discontinuity & distance
de Man: illusion that continuity can be restored by act of memory another moment of transition
“there is only memory—past does not exist”

if a past does not exist, no more does death—only mourning, figures of death, we inscribe in every trace (otherwise called “survivals”)—because they outlast us, trying their luck, in advance, “in memory of” [see p. 87n inexistence of past/death not futility/illusion]

for de Man, memory of traces of a past never present, which always remain to come—from the future, this promise of resurrection of anterior past, is a formal element, place where fictions & figures are elaborated
what if ontological difference is translated into rhetoric of memory? or vice versa?
where Derrida’s memory differentiates from Hegel’s: no link btwn Wesen & Gewesenheit, the present doesn’t pull from a past that was present, but a trace never present
memory of present divides the instant? inscribes difference in presence of present?

de Man on Baudelaire: représentation du présent [re: memory of present] combines incompatibility of repetitive & instantaneous pattern (tension); Baudelaire faithful to seduction of the present; for him, memory applies more to present that past
present-ness of present introduces ontological difference
difference btwn simple present and presence of present is never present > arises only for memory
de Man: memory of present is “a forgetting or a suppression of anteriority,” “memory effaces remembrance”

Baudelaire: “by plunging into past may lose the memory of the present,” “the stamp time imprints on our senses” “representation,” “time,” “memory”…opening perspectives of difference and distance in the uniqueness of the moment

time, memory: nothing other than figure of the marks that efface anteriority of past, “memory of the present” marks itself > only memory can recognize differential “stamp,” mark, signature, that relates a present to presence itself

[see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)
irony of using another signature to talk about yourself
de Man on Baudelaire: write so fast, precipitously, don’t let the phantom escape > a resurrection, a “ghost” story, “Lazarus, arise!”
this allegorical story of signature includes theme of “Lazarus, arise!” a “ghost” story, resurrection

ghosts always pass quickly, infinite speed, presence w/out present that in coming back only haunts > the ghost, le re-venant, the survivor, figure or fiction, presence w/out presence, instant w/out duration, not nothing

recognize in figure of phantom the working of what Kant & Heidegger assign to transcendental imagination, “fantastic” temporalizing schemes and powers of synthesis > Kant: an art hidden in depths of soul
art is a thing of the past
memory w/out memory (thinking memory); Gedächtnis w/out Erinnerung (symbolist introjection), not re-animated in the interiority of consciousness

Gedächtnis [w/out Erinnerung], a thinking memory, engagement beyond negativity, a reaffirmation of engagement, a memory that has mourned the dialectic (which is mourning itself), memory w/out mourning, rigorous fidelity of an affirmation, barely “amnesic”
must keep in memory difference of Lethe from Mnemosyne, call this aletheia

promise of the other (for the future, trace of the future) made to the other as an absolute past, the other’s sur-vival exceeds the “we” of a common present: brings together two friends, “incredible scene of memory,” written in absolute past; dictates madness of amnesic fidelity, forgetful hypermnesia, gravest and lightest
de Man: “art leaves interiorization of past forever behind” > no dialectical passage from symbol to sign; art (like thought of thinking memory) linked to sign not symbol
[re: de Man’s “Reply…”] tells us more about institutions and strategies of reading than “all the pious recitations or bits of revolutionary bravura which only revolve in place”
[de Man’s materialism: “neglected corners”?]
de Man: Hegel marginalizes sign, allegory for sake of symbol & “synthetic judgments”
thinking, not bereaved interiorization, thinks at boundaries, thinks the boundary, the limit of interiority
we must remember the power of forgetting (what tradition calls “bad”: pharmakon, sign, figure of allegory) as opposed to forgetting in the sense of interior “recollection”
de Man quotes Hegel: allegory “disarticulation of subject from predicate” > allegory as defective cornerstone of entire system [p. 76 keystone (counts for whole) vs. cornerstone]
via de Man, figure of “defective cornerstone,” “neglected corners” > required by architecture [of system], deconstructs from w/in
deconstruction seeks non-architectonic Versammlung [?], deconstruction is already in text, in architecture, must know how to identify right or wrong element
to deconstruct, given this always already, is to do memory work
via de Man, allegory (as a metonymy) is an allegory? > Hegel’s dialectic a vast allegory not of reconciliation & synthesis but of disjunction, dissociation, and discontinuity
de Man’s privileging of allegory [never reduced to metaphor] over symbol must be understood via Anglo-American criticism of Romanticism
for Derrida, each one (allegory, metaphor, trope, figure) in turn can be privileged, self reflexivity w/out end
why there must be multiple figures
all figures are ghostly figures, speak like phantoms and phantomize the text > never define trace or phantom w/out ironically/allegorically appealing from one to the other

for de Man, allegory (narrative) and irony (momentary & pointed, instantanéiste) are both figures of ghostly disjunction, duplication, doubling > together they form the rhetoric of memory, forgetting, recalling anteriority
allegory engenders continuity it knows to be illusionary
allegorical Mnemosyne / ironical Lethe
deconstruction is not a problematic nor a criticism
allegorical Mnemosyne/ironical Lethe
“must one at each instant reinvent filiation?” is this a signature of faithful memory or betrayal, figure of simulacrum?
“even if this memory of prefiguration were possible, we know that it would offer no ‘anteriority’ that was not fictive or figural; it could only ‘suppress’ or ‘forget’ it”
I can’t tell stories so I turn to myth > Mnemon: an auxiliary, a technician, artist of memory, hypomnesic servant [Derrida?]

when de Man quotes Mallarmé’s “this shallow calumniated stream called death” from “Tomb of Verlaine” (signatory of epitaph always writes on his own tomb), Derrida tells us genealogy of genitives cannot be broken by cenotaph or cremation: the tomb of Verlaine of Mallarmé of Paul de Man
inexistence of past & death not futility/illusion, their literal non-presence is also their fictive or figurative value
Pascal says don’t read too fast or slow—find a rhythm (accelerate toward rhythm)
Heidegger: is memory a container for thought [Gedachtes]? or does thinking rest in memory [Gedächtnis]?
Heidegger rethinks “thought (Gedanke)” w/ Gedanc, bottom of the heart, gathering together of all that concerns us, more original than Pascal’s thinking of heart? [Dank]
there is a promise & the thought of the promise (most important thought, most difficult and disconcerting); promise is always excessive

de Man’s texts on promise pervert tranquil assurance of what we call “performative” > too much of promise is irremediable disturbance/perversion, is also a trap, also renders promise possible (indestructible), and comical
promise is always excessive—promise too much
singular aporia that divides the act, can’t be mastered, commits us before any active commitment on our part, impossibility of promise, uncontrollable > faktum, “older”
no act before speech, no speech before act > there is this not natural “fact,” faktum, to which we’re recalled: already there, past never present, historicity itself, “ancientness” w/out history
de Man “parodies” Die Sprache spricht w/ Die Sprache verspricht—language promises (itself), no originary Sprechen modalized into promise [would Heidegger protest?] [see S p. 93-4]
via de Man, Heidegger rarely laughs and would probably be against irony as a pose of subjective mastery, never feels the exhilaration of a promise
for de Man, “allegory of unreadability”: when performative cannot be distinguished from constative, all the while remaining irreducible
promise is impossible but inevitable
every reading engaged in a promise w/in scene of a signature/writing
for De Man, we all write, like Rousseau, w/in the “misleading” of the Versprechen, which nevertheless “conveys the promise of its own truth”
apparent contradiction btwn act of reading and unreadability in the act > versprechen, promise at origin of history
every reading is writing (but we must demonstrate it, following structure of promise)
de Man: promise is “metafigural”, an allegory of a figure “which relapses into the figure it deconstructs”
writing, as an event of signature, a signature which can only promise itself in the sense that its destination is barred, impasse of aporia
you can only say and sign: yes, yes in memory of yes
the sich is “promised to the effacement it promises itself” [auto-deconstruction]
the sich, “se,” “itself,” deconstructs itself in the very act of the promise, aporetic event [spirit: ghost > auto-immunity: auto-deconstruction]
the 2 masculine values (singular or plural) of mémoire always suppose spatial inscription whereas la mémoire, even pluralized, does not
Montaigne: “good memory is scriptural, it retains its figure” vs. writing, hypomnesia, marks engraved w/in memory as on paper

to distinguish Gedächtnis (thinking memory) from Erinnerung (interiorizing memory) de Man marks irreducible link btwn memory & technical dimension of memory (art of writing, hypomnesic, exteriority of Mnemon, archivation, data banks, artificial memory) > no deconstruction w/out calling into question dissociation of thought and technology, no longer able to subscribe to Heidegger’s Die Wissenschaft denkt nicht (science does not think)
for Heidegger, thinking of essence of technology is not technology, is free of technicity, same for science [and he would say the same of rhetoric]
Heidegger: Gedanc [see pp. 140-141], heart, innermost essence of man, reaches outermost limits, the representation of interior/exterior does not arise
[if Socrates is the most original thinker then the promise’s indestructibility is forsaken?]
indispensability of speech act theory for deconstruction
for Heidegger, Socrates is “purest thinker,” did nothing else but place himself in the draft, this is why he wrote nothing
Austin’s cunning naïveté as he discusses promises and excuses
Derrida links Austin’s usage of phrases “in general” & “properly speaking”
what Derrida likes in Austin > doesn’t leave a properly philosophical thesis in place
primary gesture of deconstruction: to wonder at “curious belief” that all words are proper names
title promises, pledges
de Man confirms opposition btwn performative & constative, extends it beyond its original field > then undermines it and makes it sterile in its very principle [?]
de Man against periodization—form of dramatizing non-historical arguments [see ROP p. 114 only speak in terms of age through citation]
we can only write what can be erased—otherwise no promise, no memory
de Man: no need to deconstruct Rousseau, already done so himself > texts deconstruct themselves by themselves [Derrida agrees w/ stipulation on use of “itself (se)]

[re: de Man, word “deconstruction” inscribing itself instead of being erased] “always already” erases singularity of event, which is erased in its turn before signature of this word [“deconstruction”] > signature asserts itself as history insofar as origin of its “taking-place” is unlocatable
for de Man, Rousseau & Nietzsche both derive transcendental-referent from possibility of making promises [think futurity] [Derrida’s distress over loving both]
necessary to think America w/ mad lucidity under the light of lunacy
about de Man, Derrida says, “figures of rationality are profiled and outlined in the madness of the aporetic”
impasse (dead end) of aporia—reopening, fait appel [arrêt, arrêt]
a new thinking of the act theorists of speech acts never thought: “promises” necessary and mad [via Nietzsche, de Man]
undecidable is the condition of deconstruction (on and in [sur, dans?] this condition); in the sense of condition of possibility and, at the same time, condition as situation or destiny
auto-deconstruction where auto-, self can’t be reflected/totalized/gathered/recollected only written and caught in trap of promise
this limit, this finitude, makes one write; deconstruction makes a path of writing through the aporia (impossible); deconstruction thinks only on the level of the impossible
an aporia which, because it paralyzes, engenders
textual events accumulated under the name Rousseau, Nietzsche, belong to history or path of that singular aporia called “deconstruction”
de Man: “deconstruction of metaphysics” is impossible because in being rhetorical (btwn trope & persuasion) it is literary (doesn’t resolve relation btwn literature & philosophy)

there is no beyond-the-undecidable, remains to be thought, incalculable order of tout autre, there is no inside-the-undecidable, but an other (singular) memory calls us w/out leading us back to any anteriority > there never existed an older, more original “third term”

promise’s relation to calculation: “the staging (mise) of the promise is a committed positing (position)”; deconstruction must let itself be contaminated, without a more original “third term” deconstruction will always be figurable

staging (mise) of promise is a committed positing (position) > the undecidable that resists non-dialectizable oppositions will bear name, maintain rhetorical relation w/ opposition, will have figure of opposition, be figurable, will always let itself by parasited by figure of opposition
each deconstructive thinking constitutes a text which bears its rhetorical singularity (style of promise, figure of signature)
deconstruction is no longer Heideggerian where he tries to reclaim hierarchy, limit purity by claiming “essence of technology is nothing technology” [or thinking of rhetoricity is not rhetorical]
memory w/out anteriority, w/out origin, cannot become a Heideggerian theme
Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”
via de Man, word “political” is allegorical > “textual allegories…generate history”
de Man: the incompatibility of grammar & meaning becomes explicit when linguistic structures are stated in political terms [on the grammar, historicity of law]
de Man “as soon as a text knows what it states, in can only act deceptively…if it doesn’t act, it can’t state what it knows.” tension btwn text as narrative and text as theory
promise prohibits the gathering of Being in presence (as its condition), the condition of the possibility and impossibility of eschatology, ironic allegory of messianism
for de Man, text defined by considering a statement at the same time performative & constative > this same time never is, will never have been, will never be present
disjunction of memory & promise is the law, the text of law, the law of text
there is no gift except on aporetic condition of no present, gift is only a promise, promised memory
for Heidegger, Heissen (“to call, ” “to command” > entrust, keep safely)

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: to lose one’s language in a foreign place is the terrible chance of the promise
always necessary to excuse oneself for appropriating to oneself this work of mourning

love, friendship, memory (moment two impossible promises are involved: “to what,” “to whom” are we destined) pledged beyond death, beyond what we call, without knowing what we speak, death; it involves, from the 1st moment, in reverse, the other is dead in us
“always necessary to excuse oneself for giving,” given its risk of its being in annulled in thanks, given that it never arrives in present
promise only to a mortal, on the condition of death

une parole donnée au nom de l’autre—act of memory, act of faith > or simply an act, impossible act, only act worthy of the name: promise has meaning only w/ death of other, when friend is no longer there > promise not made, but as trace of future it can be renewed
for Heidegger, since science doesn’t think, thinking much watch over science, they cannot do so for themselves
de Man: against Schlegel, Hegel on irony’s mastery, way it rises above finite determinations
when de Man equates absolute irony w/ consciousness of madness, end of consciousness, he protects irony from its German-Romantic determination [as mastery]
via de Man’s “irony is unrelieved vertige,” never stop turning, madness because it has no reason to stop, because reason is tropic
de Man: sanity can only exist when we’re willing to function w/in conventions of duplicity & dissimulation
